column2: In the hands of skilled men, axes are terrifying weapons.
For those always on the move, raiding is survival.
Eating, sleeping, killing, dying. They are never more at home than on a horse.
What can be taken, sustains.
These men ride and shoot as if they were born on horseback.
To fire a bow from horseback requires almost unnatural skill.
Enemies run amok when these horsemen take to the field.
Having learned to survive on the harsh steppes, these men will thrive at any cost.
Once drawn, their blades must taste enemy flesh.
These men know nothing but the tribe, and how to defend it.
The Alani way of life, carried on their broad shoulders.
Generations of experience makes them the world's best horsemen.
These heavily-armoured, mounted archers can fire from the saddle at pace.
Unlike other cataphracts these men carry bows, allowing them to attack from afar before the charge.
Age and wisdom are more powerful than youthful exuberance.
All must fight for survival, no matter his place.
Men fall before them like wheat before the scythe.
A hail of arrows to announce your destruction.
These mounted skirmishers can reach key areas of the battlefield quickly.
Like lightning, these mounted troops arrive, devastate, and then leave just as swiftly.
The best of the best, armed and armoured for maximum impact.
The thundering of hooves is the sound of Death himself.
Tempered from the forge, resilient blades for the most resilient of men.
An axe may be crude, but it does the job admirably.
The rugged terrain of their homeland has shaped these warriors.
The skills of the hunt - hiding and a sudden strike - are the skills of a warrior.
One axe can topple a tree. Many can level the forest.
There is a deep savagery in these warrior's hearts; a delight in battle for its own sake.
Got my axe, got my mushrooms... AAAARRGGGHHH!!!!!""
A deer or a man: the target still needs killing.
Robbery and plunder - and the skills they require - can be usefully applied on the battlefield.
Victory rides a horse.
There's no arguing with a quarrel.
The chance to improve their social position makes these men fierce opponents.
Strength in battle determines who is fit to lead.
Even the poorest of the tribe can fight for its honour and glory.
Their rage and pride is focused on a sharpened point.
A warrior grasps the spear firmly, so that it does not shake in his hand.
They are not famed for their elegant bladework, they are feared for it.
Nobles can afford the best armour and weaponry, making them a formidable force.
These men fight with proven bravery and well-honed skill-at-arms.
When the trees whisper their secrets, these men know how to hear them.
These men raid. It is what they do.
Stalking a man is no different to stalking a deer.
Protectors of the peace, in exchange for shelter.
Freedom, glory and the chaos of battle. What else is there\?
If you want the best, and you desire victory, you need gallowglasses.
Man's best friend can also be a savage, terrible enemy.
These men always find their targets, even in the stiffest highland winds.
Only whisperers know the word"."
The backbone of any successful raiding mission.
What's yours is theirs. In fact, it was never really yours.
What these men lack in armour, they make up for in ferocity.
Even powerful men do great deeds to please their king.
These men will ride with their king, no matter the outcome.
All the king's horses and all the king's men will cut you into little pieces.
The force of the spear is tenfold when braced by a steed.
Born to lead, their arrows fly truest.
Few men willingly hold the line when an onager fires on them.
The axe embodies Pictish fierceness.
These men were terrifying long before the mushroom told its tale.
The sword will free the land and feed it with invaders' blood.
Their distinctive shields ensure these men are known to all.
There is no hunting like the hunting of man.
These stealthy warriors blend in with their surroundings, just as the shadow maid taught them.
The thrust of the spear is the end of the hunt.
The future kings of men must be harder than others.
The wolves are on the hunt. Eternally.
The sheer size of this vessel makes it ideal for transporting troops.
This transport ship is light and easy to manoeuvre.
Teach a man to ride and use a lance, and he can fight for his people.
These men will fight, and pillage, to further the cause of their people.
A spear to fight for their people, and their future.
Hardened by battle, weathered by the desert.
Camels are strange and ungainly, but cover them in armour and they charge like the rest.
Camels may not gallop like horses, but their unpredictable style gives them an edge.
A camel is a bizarre beast, yet has its advantages in battle.
No wind, no trees, no barriers; the desert is the perfect place to fire a bow.
Men of the sand do not look to a leader unless he is strong.
Slingshot can fly a great distance in the uninterrupted vastness of the desert.
The only loyalty these men have is to themselves, survival and continued coin.
The levy fight because they must. War is unforgiving. The desert even more so.
The speed to outmanoeuvre, and the ability to kill from afar, are invaluable in the desert.
In the vastness of the desert, the speed to be everywhere at once can be decisive.
These men fight for nobody but themselves, and whoever pays the most.
To be of the desert is to be as the desert - swift and deadly.
Give a man a spear and hope he knows end from end. The desert takes no prisoners.
The men of the desert are hardy, weathered by the heat and the endless sand.
The desert shapes tough men, and even tougher kings of men.
The Nubian bow is a work of art on the canvas of war.
Our father must be protected from the heathen hordes who seek his end.
Experienced hunters who can kill at some distance.
The hunt glorifies the hunter.
The smell, the noise, their curved swords glinting in the sun. Your imminent death.
The blink of an eye; the flash of the blade.
Their curved blades are double-edged for maximum bloodletting.
Whatever you may hear, there are none more fierce than the Dawser.
Tribal youths taken as hostages against the future good behaviour of their fathers.
The royal guard are the king's closest friends and relatives.
We are the tribes of the moon!""
Armoured melee troops armed with the deadly shotel.
A rain of death to quench the desert heat.
By the morning and evening stars, they will bring victory.
Desert skirmishers who can melt back into the dunes as swiftly as they appeared.
Be bold, be brave, be brutal.
These men are ferocious, axe-wielding tribal lunatics.
We will kill until no enemy breathes Aksumite air.""
Thundering death, in the name of God, St. Michael and St. George.
When cavalry is king, a wall of pikes evens the odds somewhat.
A storm is coming. Our storm. And when it arrives it will shake the world.""
Armed with spears, they are the elite among tribal forces.
Fanatical fighters, armed with the deadly shotel, and ready to die.
Camels and axes together are an alarming prospect for anyone facing their charge.
Mounted javelinmen schooled in cavalry skirmish tactics.
For whom God is both armour and sword.
Favoured nobles must pledge service in return for privilege.
Their poison-tipped arrows lead only to madness and death.
They have promised their lives in the service of their queen.
Emperor… we come for you!""
Her name is a killing word.
The scourge of the east kill in the name of their warrior queen.
Poison arrows fill the sky, and death flies with them.
Their spears are the cross; they kill in the Lord's name.
Tribal youths taken as hostages against the future good behaviour of their fathers.
These men keep their prince alive. It is their sole purpose.
Stand up and die in revolution's name.
Javelin-armed tribal skirmishers, these men know how to use the terrain to their best advantage.
God made Arabia to train the faithful. Who are we to go against the word of God\?""
They will defend the temple to the very last.
Outlaws, yet favoured by the king for their ferocity and skill-at-arms.
When the storm hits, death rides at its head.
They kill at the command of the war god himself.
The spice must flow. These men ensure that it continues to do so.
Paralyse nerves, shatter bones, set fires, suffocate an enemy or burst his organs.""
Spear-armed warriors, they are the mainstay of any tribal army.
Knowledge of the terrain and the element of surprise, combined to deadly effect.
Where eastern fury and western tactics meet.
One thousand men, with one year to prove their worth in royal service.
Armed with axes, the Sentinels guard the capital with their lives.
The enemy are their equals. God is their only master.
The stars dictate their actions, their allegiances, their fates.
The desert is brutal, and produces brutal warriors. The hunters are proof of that.
From their Saharan strongholds, these lancers strike out at would-be threats.
A curved sword, swung from horseback, can do terrible things to a man.
The curved shotel slices the parts other swords cannot reach.
Across the shimmering dunes, these men appear as a mirage until the final, deadly realisation.
You will find no better cavalry in all of Africa, if not the world.
Load. Aim. Fire. Hope for the best.
Load. Aim. Fire. Hope for the best.
Indomitable defenders, these men are as resolute as the very mountains.
The camel fares better in the desert than the horse. The spear doesn't judge.
The decks of this warship are teeming with deadly artillery pieces.
Battery dromon can kill from afar better than most, but will suffer heavy losses if boarded.
A heavy warship, the dromon is the master of the waves.
A heavy warship, the dromon is the master of the waves.
A heavy warship, the dromon is the master of the waves.
Unquenchable flames are every sailor's darkest nightmare.
Unquenchable flames are every sailor's darkest nightmare.
A heavy warship, the dromon is the master of the waves.
A heavy warship, the dromon is the master of the waves.
When greed and villainy set sail, treachery is never far behind them…
When greed and villainy set sail, treachery is never far behind them…
When greed and villainy set sail, treachery is never far behind them…
Dromonarion are light, swift and easy to manoeuvre.
Difficult to control, and just as deadly to its users as the enemy.
When the sea itself is aflame, where is a man to turn\?
When the sea itself is aflame, where is a man to turn\?
When the sea itself is aflame, where is a man to turn\?
When the sea itself is aflame, where is a man to turn\?
Light and easy to manoeuvre, this ship is ideal for skirmish tactics.
Light and easy to manoeuvre, this ship is ideal for skirmish tactics.
Light and easy to manoeuvre, this ship is ideal for skirmish tactics.
Light and easy to manoeuvre, this ship is ideal for skirmish tactics.
Light and easy to manoeuvre, this ship is ideal for skirmish tactics.
Light and easy to manoeuvre, this ship is ideal for skirmish tactics.
This sling is the prize of the Armenian military. Don't miss.
As the bulk of the army, these spearmen may not be skilled but they are numerous.
You stand even less of a chance against elephants when armoured.
Adorned in heavy, decorative armour, even a camel can look resplendent.
N/A
High quality infantry - dogmatic and skilled.
With the fervour of God, and skill at arms, these men bring death to the field.
Each man fights with the fervour and strength of ten thousand.
These riders do not think themselves better, they know it.
The Grivpanvar strike fear, and a four metre lance, into the hearts of their enemies.
Even at the Bridge of Judgement, the Gyan-Avspar will fight for the king.
If they cut off one head, another shall take its place.
A man can quickly learn to fight any manner of beast. Massed elephants are the exception.
Kurdish archers are held in high regard, especially by their enemies.
The javelin is an extension of the arm.
In the name of their overlord, these men will see the battlefield laid bare.
Burning oil, when thrown into enemy formations, has exactly the result you would expect.
Load. Aim. Fire. Hope for the best.
This thing could probably launch a fortress, given the chance.
Load. Aim. Fire. Hope for the best.
Wave after wave of conscripted peasants to increase numbers and drive before the enemy.
A Persian who masters the art of the bow is without equal.
The composite bow is a deadly tool, particularly in Persian hands.
Persians, steeped in the history of their land, ready to fight in its name.
An agile, ranged force, defended from horsemen by their particular smell.
Camels confuse and baffle, but if anyone can ride them, Persians can.
Persian cataphracts, the purest breed, can almost smash through city walls.
Throwing a stone is easy. Killing a man with one; that takes skill.
The levy are peasants drafted to fight. They oil the machine of war.
An archer on horseback can be almost everywhere at once.
In eastern climates, it is advantageous to ride where those on foot would falter.
These men lay claim to Achaemenid ancestry, and will fight in its name.
Scouts are the eyes of an army, ensuring the fist strikes true, and strikes hard.
Skirmishers are perfect for frustrating the enemy before a larger attack.
To the very end, the Pushtighban will fight.
Their arrows fly forth in the name of the king.
When this onager fires, it is as if the heavens themselves descend.
The hammer-blow of the Savaran charge; cataphracts lay low all before them.
Savaran are not part of the Persian military, they ARE the Persian military.
Savaran are drawn from the nobility; the highest positions for those most noble.
Sogdians are keen in the ways of war; a camel is but another weapon.
The Sogdians are fierce, and their warriors feared.
To the four corners of the earth, these men will fight for their king.
The finest warriors in the world, at their king's command.
These blue-haired, tattooed warriors strike fear into their enemy's hearts.
One man's grave goods can save another's life.
The horsemen of the Alani make fearless leaders.
Alani horsemen carry spear and shield into battle.
Alani spearmen are well suited to fighting mounted warriors.
Dedication to their craft goes beyond that of any man.
As beautiful as they are deadly.
Fleet-footed steeds and bold riders make for the best scouts.
Noble, mounted shock troops, extremely useful for charging flanks and melee.
An axe to the throat is a sure way to fell your enemy.
A shared grievance unites people in a unique and enduring way.
A volley of javelins will stop rival skirmishers. Dead.
What these men lack in style, they make up for with sheer power.
A screen of trained skirmishers, for harassing the enemy, cannot be over-valued.
Resplendent, even amidst the chaos of battle.
The two-handed axe lacks grace, but is brutally efficient.
The two-handed axe lacks grace, but is brutally efficient.
From horseback, the head becomes a much more viable target.
A charging swordsman holds no terror next to a ravenous war dog.
It doesn't matter who owned it first, only who owns it now.
They fight for their king, and raid what they can for the tribe.
They fight for their king, and raid what they can for the tribe.
These men have proven their brutality and been chosen for it.
N/A
Heavily armoured and carrying a deadly axe, these horsemen deal in death. Exclusively.
The Agarhyrsi pride themselves on their ability to deal death.
If it's out there, these men will find and make use of it.
The skill of these warrior women is legendary.
A skilled archer is worth his weight in gold.
An impenetrable wall of pikes that few can best.
Unlike other cataphracts these men carry bows, allowing them to attack from afar before the charge.
Why throw one stone, when you can throw SEVEN!\?
A sword is a fine weapon but nothing if wielded without skill.
The Franks are fond of their axes. Very fond.
A man's worth is only as great as his ambition.
Frankish men know how to get their points across.
Frankish skirmishers are lightly armoured, ideal for harrying enemy troops.
Freemen always fight better than slaves.
These men can skewer their enemies from a considerable distance.
Their longbows give greater range and accuracy.
In times of war all must take up arms.
Seasoned hunters to harry the enemy from afar.
Leave them dead and rob their corpses. Repeat ad infinitum.
At the right range, armour is no defence against a crossbow bolt.
Spear-armed Germanic riders, ideal for melee combat.
These warriors possess unbridled aggression and a reckless bravery.
A rain of stones can lead to rash decisions.
Shock cavalry, armed with lances, are ideal for spearing enemy hearts.
German tribespeople, called to battle in times of war.
Armed with spear and javelin, these mounted raiders are ideal battlefield scouts.
These mounted warriors have joined together to fight for their tribe.
Only the bravest dare mount a raid under cover of darkness.
Noblemen spend their lives preparing for war.
A wall of pikes is an excellent defence, but is difficult to manoeuvre.
Tribal raiders, unafraid to tread unknown paths.
These warriors possess unbridled aggression and a reckless bravery.
These brave fighters face cavalry charges with a will of iron.
The ties of family make these warriors strong.
Selected by their god, they fight possessed by Godan himself!
Selected by their god, they fight possessed by Godan himself!
Inflamed by dance, these men fight with passion and fury!
Every good archer believes his shot will reach its target.
These man carry a falx, nothing more. They need nothing more.
A man who acknowledges no equals and fears nothing inspires loyalty.
The Goths know the importance of striking hard and true.
Tribesmen of the Gothic Kingdom, called from the land to defend their people.
Once men of Rome, they have cast aside their vows to fight for the Goths.
A pike can pierce armour and pluck horsemen from their mounts.
Bonds struck during times of war are difficult to break.
Age and wisdom are more powerful than youthful exuberance.
These men defy tactics, even logic, to achieve their aims.
To attack a moving horse takes tremendous bravery, or stupidity.
Resplendent, even amidst the chaos of battle.
The club may be inelegant, but few can deny that it works.
Steeds as fast as the shifting sands, and riders just as deadly.
Armoured riders of noble birth, they fight with spears in battle.
Protected by chainmail, these spear-armed riders are deadly in melee.
A noble name will never perish.
A nobleman sits on a horse better than any low-born rider.
There is little as terrifying as a skilled swordsman.
Great engines can hurl great weights over great distances.
Bigger is always better when it comes to the crushing of one's enemies.
Great engines can hurl great weights over great distances.
A Roman cloak does not make its wearer a true" Roman."
The club punctuates war’s brutal poetry.
These men do not need heavy armour, their skill with a blade protects them.
The strength of their charge is drawn from a fierce loyalty to their king.
The strength of their charge is drawn from a fierce loyalty to their king.
A good ruler is both feared and respected.
Clad in the finest armour available, these riders are terrifying to look upon.
The Sacra Francisca are the finest lancers ever to sit upon a horse.
Lancers are ideal shock troops for charging down the enemy.
These heavily-armoured, mounted archers can fire from the saddle at pace.
Gleaming in their scale armour, cataphracts are a fearsome sight.
These mounted skirmishers can reach key areas of the battlefield quickly.
Standing shoulder to shoulder, these warriors provide protection from cavalry.
A warband is kept together by its shared experiences.
The club punctuates war’s brutal poetry.
A well-trained slinger is lethal with a stone, and a menace with many.
What good are swords to the dead\?
They are present to embolden their men and strike fear into the enemy.
The champion's vigorous charge shatters enemy formations.
Those with status must set an example on the battlefield.
These men have sworn to fight, and by the spear they shall!
Warriors of the Suebi confederation fight with the utmost fury.
A sword should be an extension of its bearer's arm.
Sons of the dragon, these horsemen are swift and deadly.
Bound by sworn oaths of loyalty, these men are staunch fighters.
The Thracian's bloodthirsty reputation is well deserved.
Battle-hardened madmen who will happily charge into the jaws of death.
Vandals value bravery and disregard the wellbeing of others.
It takes the strongest of men to lead the strongest of men.
With swords and slings, they can attack from afar or hand-to-hand.
The young wolf lacks the wisdom of his elder, but none of the vigour.
The smashed and splintered deck of an enemy ship is a beautiful sight.
The smashed and splintered deck of an enemy ship is a beautiful sight.
Armed with heavy onagers, this vessel can reduce lesser ships to splinters.
When the drums beat, the oars pull as one.
When the drums beat, the oars pull as one.
When the drums beat, the oars pull as one.

The sea is freedom and adventure to all those who sail upon her.
